title: CVE-2020-24307 and CVE-2023-30367
author: etug80
body_snippet:
Hello Folks!

I'm glad to come across mRemoteNG when I searched for Libre Software alternative to SecureCRT.

Unfortunately, when I requested my organization to install mRemoteNG (either v1.76.20 or v1.77.3.1784-NB) on my work laptop, the SOC team rejected my request citing the following CVEs.
[1] https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-24307
[2] https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-30367

Any inside information regarding these?

P.S.
Thank you all f...

comments.snippet: yes, issue exist and currently working to eliminate in new 1.77.3 realize, what require a big code chuck to change so a bit slow with release...
comments.author: Kvarkas

comments.snippet:
Hi,

NIST just posted an official statement regarding mRemoteNG a few weeks ago:
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-30367
btw, we have to stop using mRemoteNG at work because of this. It's sad that there are no new builds.
Linking [this](#2474) thread yet again.

Regards,
J.
comments.author: JeanPluzo

comments.snippet: Still hoping for a new build
comments.author: Avrution

comments.snippet: I think you meant to link #2474 there @JeanPluzo
